isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION, TANDEM AXLE: INTERNATIONAL - REMOVE - REAR CARRIER FROM AXLE HOUSING

note.para: Steam clean axle assembly before removing rear carrier.

step1.para: Remove drain plug and drain lubricant.
Disconnect drive shaft at rear U-joint.

note.para: If pinion or pinion bearings are to be removed, break loose pinion nut at this time.

step1.para: Hold a large brass drift or a brass hammer against the center of the axle shaft flange. Strike the drift with sharp blows from a large hammer or sledge, until axle shaft separates from hub.

warning.para: Do not strike the axle flange directly with a steel hammer or sledge. This may crack and splinter material, possibly causing serious or fatal injury. Do not pry or chisel axle flange away from hub or damage to sealing surfaces could occur.

step1.para: Support carrier assembly on roller jack. Secure as necessary to prevent carrier from falling from jack when removed from housing.
Loosen differential carrier-to-axle housing bolts. Remove all bolts except top two. These two bolts will prevent carrier assembly from falling.
Separate carrier from housing using removal slots ( Figure 5). Be certain carrier is balanced properly on jack, and remove top two carrier mounting bolts. Remove carrier assembly from axle housing.
Mount carrier assembly in a suitable rebuild stand. Refer to SPECIAL TOOLSp.
